sub_title: Professor and Chair (Dept. Head) of Cell Biology & Immunology, CSO, and former Chair of the Young Academy of Europe. Working on multimodal imaging, and imaging agents to study and modulate the immune system.
summary:
I am a versatile and highly-successful senior scientist and group leader with a proven track record leading world-class research programmes end to end and publishing influential papers in respected journals; securing €multimillion funding, establishing international partnerships and significantly improving the profile and impact of multidisciplinary research activities. Currently, I split my time successfully between a prestigious academic institution (WUR) as head of the Cell Biology and Immunology Group, and my spin-off company, Cenya Imaging BV. I am a post Chair of the Young Academy of Europe, which is a group of highly successful young academics working to influence science policy for the better. I recently became a member of the Wageningen Young Academy. 

I have a reputation as a confident, authoritative and commercially astute leader with a finger on the pulse of scientific developments and the ability to identify and capitalise on innovative solutions to complex medical challenges. An accomplished communicator and presenter, I am able to forge stakeholder relations at all levels, as well as building and motivating research teams, staff and students.

Please get in touch if you would like to know more. 

Specialities: 
Leader, leadership, management, grants, funding, proposals, science, medicine, research, analysis, scholarship, education, projects, consultancy, strategy, planning, evaluation, innovation, teaching, lecturing, course design, examinations, assessment, supervision, mentoring, internships, undergraduate, postgraduate, MPhil, PhD, research programmes, training, problem-solving, start-ups, patents, commercial partnerships, teambuilding, appraisals, publications, editing, committees, policy development, biochemistry, in vivo cell tracking, in vivo cell quantification, magnetic resonance imaging, MRI, 19F MRI, multimodal imaging, cell labelling, label development, cell-based therapy, nanoparticles, cell tracking, international, European, Netherland

Radbound University Medical Centre (RUMC), Netherlands

•	Took research from the fundamental stage through to commercialisation and clinical testing
•	> 50 invited talks internationally, including plenaries and keynotes, incl. major conferences, and, UNESCO (2020)
•	Developed independent research line, on new types of nanoparticle agents for multiple types of imaging, while being the only imaging specialist in an immunology lab
•	Helped manage post-doctoral staff, technicians, students and interns; inspiring trust and resolving staffing issues
•	Led a €12M H2020 cell tracking project proposal; coordinating 20 international industrial and academic partners
•	Led in vivo animal model implementation, imaging and development for clinical application & production upscaling 
•	Worked alongside immunologists, chemists, physicists, radiologists & cardiologists on multidisciplinary studies
•	Shortlisted for a World Molecular Imaging Society WIMIN Outstanding Leadership in Molecular Imaging Award in 2019, based on recommendations from group members for being an excellent mentor (and friend)
•	Ranked #1 expert in the field worldwide (“19F MRI”) on expertscape.com.
•	Overall, acquired over €12M euros in grants, including some of the most prestigious, such as 3 ERC grants
•	Personally funded and supervised group members (interns, technicians, Ph.D. students and postdoc)
•	Published about 50 papers, several of which have been cited over 100 times
